intro: Dendroviguiera sharpii, commonly known as the sharp's dendroviguiera, is a climbing shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
